text: it is that time of year again at the
time of year that I get super excited to
start baking it's summer which means
fruit desserts are on the agenda and
today it's a very simple straightforward
but fantastic strawberry cobbler cut up
two pounds of strawberries you're going
to need a total of six cups if you
quarter them go strawberry picking and
then come home and make this recipe I
love strawberry picking your fruit in a
big bowl you're going to mix everything
together right here in this bowl for the
filling add a cup of sugar 1/3 of a cup
of corn starch it seems like a lot
strawberries are very watery so you need
a lot of thickener so don't skimp on
that then a teaspoon of salt coarse salt
don't use fine salt well if you do just
use a half a teaspoon and then two
tablespoons of fresh lemon juice the
acidity and the lemon juice is really
nice to offset the sweetness in the
strawberries and strawberries in season
can be very very sweet it's usually
about a half a lemon so I'm just going
to go ahead and use a whole half a lemon
get your oven preheating to 375 degrees
because this is not going to take very
long to put together and you want to
make sure your oven is ready for you
when you're ready for it stir together
until nicely combined transfer this to a
two and a half quart baking dish you're
going to want to make sure that it's at
least two and a half quarts so that the
juices don't overflow set that aside for
a second then you can make your biscuit
mixture here I have one in 3/4 cups of
all-purpose flour to that add a quarter
cup of sugar 3/4 of a teaspoon of coarse
salt and one in 3/4 teaspoons of baking
powder whisk everything really well to
combine and then you can add your cold
butter it's six tablespoons of cold
butter I just like to work this in with
my fingers I think it's faster I'm
leaving some bits of butter in here for
flakiness and tenderness it's the
texture of coarse crumbs but there still
should be some pieces that are like the
size of small
to that add one cup of heavy cream these
are really tender and delicious biscuits
and it comes from the cream it's not
like you're eating it for dinner it's a
special treat this is one of my favorite
biscuits to put on top of any kind of
cobbler I put it on peaches and
blueberries I put it on apricots but the
first one I get to make every spring is
strawberry all right then what you want
to do is sort of doll up this on top of
your strawberry mixture I like to use
two tablespoons to do it you want to mix
your dough just until it holds together
you don't want to over mix it scoop it
onto your fruit it can be slightly
uneven sometimes they sort of run
together in the oven anyway so don't
worry too much about they're all exactly
the same size it kind of doesn't matter
the dough is kind of sticky so it's nice
to use the tablespoons to get the dough
on top and then you need to make about
nine total also you might find that it's
like a sticky issue but it might not be
completely holding together and don't
worry about that either because as it
bakes they puff up and they hold
together so everything comes together in
the end then what you want to do just
for color you don't actually have to do
this is brush the top slightly with just
a little bit more heavy cream and then
sprinkle with some sugar also this is
optional you don't need to do it but it
adds a nice crunch and helps with the
golden color on the top then you want to
bake it 375 degrees for an hour and 10
minutes it should be bubbling in the
center and the biscuits should be golden
and if you want to catch the drips that
might go over the top just in case put a
baking pan on the rack underneath the
rack that you bake this on hour and ten
minutes Wow look at that bubbling and
golden delightfulness you should give it
at least an hour to cool down to prove
to you guys that I've been patient and I
waited long enough for this to cool down
enough to eat I am carrying it without
pot holders see it didn't just come
right out of the oven you got to give it
time to cool down just a little bit so
the juices have time to thicken so a
little juicy I'm doing this for you guys
I want you to see the magnet
that this strawberry cobbler is maybe
you want to serve it with a little bit
of ice cream you could also pour a
little bit of heavy cream right over the
top that's really good I always love a
scoop of ice cream strawberry cobbler
